commits.message: Adding backup folder request service to get the backup folder details (#2274)
Optimize parallel message processing to be enabled by default (#2216)

payload.description: SQL Tools API service that provides SQL Server data management capabilities.

commits.message: Optimize parallel message processing to be enabled by default (#2216)
Optimize parallel message processing to be enabled by default (#2216)

pull_request.title: Optimize parallel message processing to be enabled by default
pull_request.body:
This PR makes necessary changes + some grooming to enable parallel message processing by default.
_Enabling this feature by default applies to all feature services where handlers have called in for enabling this property._
 
Noteworthy changes:
- The limit on number of parallel operations that can be queued is now configurable by user. It's set to 100 by default, which should be optimal.
- PMP is enabled on all Object Explorer operations.
- PMP is disabled for `SubsetRequest` since the execution of this request should be ordered and not in parallel. Disabling PMP on this one will always queue this request on the main dispatcher thread and not as a detached task.

![image](https://github.com/microsoft/sqltoolsservice/assets/13396919/96f28e7d-1e6b-4235-a83c-edfad2e623cb)

repo.name: sqltoolsservice
repo.description: SQL Tools API service that provides SQL Server data management capabilities.

repo.name: sqltoolsservice
repo.description: SQL Tools API service that provides SQL Server data management capabilities.

comment.body: What about adding the code to the message dispatcher instead? Saves having to add this line to every single request/event

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -123,11 +123,11 @@ public override void InitializeService(IProtocolEndpoint serviceHost)
 
             // Not enabling parallel processing for OEService as it might cause OE to hang.
comment.body: I haven't noticed any hangs with this and there would have been other reasons why it happened before, as we noticed it happening even with disabled PMP - will remove comment.

comment.body: The timing of logs can differ based on when the handler task begins (which is based on semaphore) so I see no harm in having both logs. It can help us investigate issues if parallel message processing blocks tasks for longer periods of time.

comment.body:
We already log the incoming messages 

https://github.com/microsoft/sqltoolsservice/blob/16c7e323567023b08200ab35b2bfb2a5042385e0/src/Microsoft.SqlTools.Hosting/Hosting/Protocol/MessageDispatcher.cs#L211

Do we really need another log that's basically doing the same thing?
